brief_title: Four-Drug Combination Treatment in Hiv-Infected Subjects Failing Therapy With Antiretroviral Regimens
brief_summary: This is a 48 week study for HIV-infected patients who have failed several regimens including PI's, NNRTs and NRTIs. Patients will be randomly selected to be in 1 of 4 groups. Three of the 4 groups will contain capravirine in different doses combined with Kaletra and nucleosides and one of the groups will be a combination of Kaletra and nucleosides without the capravirine.
criteria: Inclusion Criteria: - HIV-infected male or female at least 18 years of age - HIV RNA level >1000 copies/mL at screening - Subject has failed regimens that included at least 1 protease inhibitor but not more than 3 protease inhibitors, at least 1 nonnucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor, and least 2 nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors - Adequate renal function - Adequate hematological function - Adequate liver function Exclusion Criteria: - Women who are pregnant or lactating - No previous experience with Kaletra
